p:
Methyl 8-hydroxy-1,6-naphthyridine-7-carboxylate (10.0 grams, 48.9 mmol) prepared as described in Example 1 was dissolved/suspended in MeOH (100 mL) and treated with 4-fluorobenzylamine (6.1g, 48.9 mmol). The reaction was brought to reflux and the MeOH allowed to evaporate until the total volume was approximately 30 mL. The reaction was refluxed for 5 hours more and a white solid precipitated. The reaction was cooled and the solid collected by filtration, washed with a minimum of MeOH and dried on the pump to give the product as a white solid. 1H NMR ( d-DMSO, 400MHz) δ 13.7 (s, 1H), 9.88 (1H, t, J = 5.7 Hz), 9.17(1H, d, J = 3.5 Hz), 8.92 (1H, s), 8.61 (1H, d, J=8.2 Hz), 7.83 (1H, dd, J= 4.2, 8.2 Hz), 7.43 (2H, m), 7.16 (2H, m), 4.55 (2H, d, J=6.4 Hz).
ESI HRMS exact mass calcd for C 16H 12N 3O 2F 298.0987 (MH +), found 298.1029 (MH +).
